00067 template <class T> class matrix {
00068 private: vector<vector<T> > array;
00069 public:
00070         matrix(): array(0) {}
00071         matrix(int rows, int cols) : array(rows) {
00072                 for (int i = 0; i < rows; ++i)
00073                         array[i].resize(cols);
00074         }
00075         void resize(int rows, int cols) {
00076                 array.resize(rows);
00077                 for (int i=0; i < rows; ++i)
00078                         array[i].resize(cols);
00079         }
00080         matrix (int rows, int cols, T value) : array(rows) {
00081                 for (int i = 0; i < rows; ++i) {
00082                         array[i].resize(cols);
00083                         for (int j = 0; j < cols; ++j)
00084                                 array[i][j] = value;
00085                 }
00086         }
00087         const vector<T> & operator[](int row) const {
00088                 return array[row];}
00089         vector<T> & operator[](int row) {
00090                 return array[row];}
00091         int nRows() const {return array.size();}
00092         int nCols() const {return nRows() > 0 ? array[0].size() : 0;}
00093         double average() const {double sum = 0;
00094                 for (int i=0; i < nRows(); ++i) 
00095                         sum += mean(array[i]);
00096                 return sum / (double) nRows();
00097         }
00098         double average(const int minr, const int maxr,
00099                 const int minc, const int maxc) const {
00100 
00101                 if ((minr <0 || minr > maxr || maxr >= nRows()) || 
00102                                 (minc <0 || minc > maxc || maxc >= nCols())) {
00103                         throw "average";
00104                 }
00105                 double sum=0;
00106                 for (int i = minr; i <= maxr; ++i) {
00107                         double rowSum = 0;
00108                         for (int j = minc; j <= maxc; ++j) {
00109                                 rowSum += array[i][j];
00110                         }
00111                         sum += rowSum / (double) (maxc - minc + 1);
00112                 }
00113                 return sum / (double)(maxr - minr + 1);
00114         }
00115         void show() {
00116                 for (int i = 0; i < nRows(); ++i) {
00117                         printVector(array[i]);
00118                 }
00119         }
00120         const matrix<T> & operator=(const matrix<T> & rhs) {
00121                 if (this != &rhs) {
00122                         this->resize(rhs.nRows(), rhs.nCols());
00123                         for (int i = 0; i < rhs.nRows(); ++i) {
00124                                 for (int j = 0; j < rhs.nCols(); ++j) {
00125                                         (*this)[i][j] = rhs[i][j];
00126                                 }
00127                         }
00128                 }
00129                 return *this;
00130         }
00131 };
00132 
00133 template<class T> double mean(const vector<T> & v) {
00134         if (v.empty()) {
00135                 throw "mean";
00136         }
00137         double sum = 0;
00138         for (int i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i) {
00139                 sum += v[i];
00140         }
00141         return sum / (double) v.size();
00142 }
00143 
00144 template<class T> double sumSquareDiff(const vector<T> & v, const double mv) {
00145         if (v.empty()) {
00146                 throw "sumSquareDiff";
00147         }
00148         double sum = 0;
00149         for (int i = 0; i < v.size(); ++i) {
00150                 double difference = v[i] - mv;
00151                 sum += difference * difference;
00152         }
00153         return sum;
00154 }

00156 double affxstat::gammln(double xx)
00157 {
00158         double x,y,tmp,ser;
00159 
00160         y = x = xx;
00161         tmp = x+5.5;
00162         tmp -= (x+.5)*log(tmp);
00163         ser = 1.000000000190015;
00164         ser += 76.18009172947146/++y;
00165         ser += -86.5053/++y;
00166         ser += 24.014/++y;
00167         ser += -1.23/++y;
00168         ser += -0.0012/++y;
00169         return((double)(-1*tmp+log(2.506628*ser/x)));
00170 }
00171 
00172 double affxstat::log_gamma(double aa)
00173 {
00174         double retval;
00175         double series;
00176         double a = aa;
00177         double g = 5;
00178         double z;
00179         double t;
00180 
00181         // compute log_gamma(aa)) by Lanczos approximation
00182         // order 6
00183         // log_gamma(a) = log((sqrt(2*pi)/a)*(x_0+x_1/(a+1)+...)(a+g+.5)^(a+.5)exp(-(a+g+.5))
00184         // is this even correct?
00185         series = 1.000000000190015;
00186         series +=  76.18009172947146/(a+1);
00187         series += -86.50532032941677/(a+2);
00188         series +=  24.01409824083091/(a+3);
00189         series += -1.231739516/(a+4);
00190         series +=  0.0012058003/(a+5);
00191         series += -0.00000536382/(a+6);
00192         series *= 2.50662827465/a; // sqrt(2*pi)/a
00193         z = a+g+.5;
00194         t = z-(a+.5)*log(z);
00195         retval = log(series)-t;
00196         return(retval);
00197 }
00198 
00199 double continued_fraction_recurrence(double *a, double *b, double n, double d)
00200 {
00201         long i;
00202         double tmp;
00203         // do steps of continued fraction
00204         // shift right
00205         a[2] = a[1];
00206         a[1] = a[0];
00207         b[2] = b[1];
00208         b[1] = b[0];
00209         // n/d
00210         a[0] = a[1]*d + a[2]*n;  // numerator times second in past, denominator times past
00211         b[0] = b[1]*d + b[2]*n;  // numerator times second in past, denominator times past
00212         // what if b[0] = 0?  how do I fix?
00213         tmp = b[0];
00214         for (i=0; i<3; i++)
00215         {
00216                 a[i] /= tmp;
00217                 b[i] /= tmp;
00218         }
00219         return(a[0]); // current value of function
00220 }
00221 
00222 double affxstat::log_beta(double a, double b)
00223 {
00224         double t, s;
00225         t = affxstat::gammln(a)+ affxstat::gammln(b)- affxstat::gammln(a+b);
00226         s = affxstat::log_gamma(a)+ affxstat::log_gamma(b)- affxstat::log_gamma(a+b);
00227         return(s);
00228 }
00229 
00230 double Incomplete_Gamma_Continued_Fraction(double a, double z, bool doLog) {
00231   // compute Q_(a,z)
00232   // as [z^a exp(-z) / Gamma(a)] * 1/(z+(1-a)/1+1/z+(2-a)/1+2/z+(3-a)/...)
00233   double Pn[3], Qn[3];
00234   int j;
00235   double old,numerator,denominator;
00236 
00237   // start one step into the recurrence
00238   Pn[1] = 1;
00239   Pn[0] = 0;
00240   Qn[1] = 0;
00241   Qn[0] = 1;
00242 
00243   numerator   = 1;
00244   denominator = z;
00245   continued_fraction_recurrence(Pn, Qn, numerator, denominator);
00246   for(j=2; j < AFFX_STAT_CONTINUED_FRACTION_MAX_ITERATION; j++) {
00247     old = 1/Pn[0]; // old value
00248     if(j % 2 == 0) {
00249       numerator   = (j/2)-a;
00250       denominator = 1;
00251     } else {
00252       numerator   = (j-1)/2;
00253       denominator = z;
00254     }
00255     continued_fraction_recurrence(Pn, Qn, numerator, denominator);
00256     if (fabs(1-Pn[0]*old) < AFFX_STAT_CONTINUED_FRACTION_EPSILON)
00257       break;
00258   }
00259 
00260   // now we've done the continued fraction, multiply in the initial term
00261   double ans = a*log(z)-z- affxstat::log_gamma(a)+log(Pn[0]);
00262   if(!doLog)
00263     ans = exp(ans);
00264 
00265   return(ans);
00266 }
00267 
00268 double Incomplete_Gamma_Power_Series(double a, double z, bool doLog) {
00269   // compute Q_(a,z)
00270   // as 1 - [ z^a / Gamma(a) * (1/a - z/(a+1) + z^2/(2(a+2)) + ...) ]
00271 
00272   double oldsum,sum,numerator,denominator,multiplier,log_z;
00273   numerator = 0;
00274   multiplier = 1;
00275   log_z = log(z);
00276   sum=log(1/a);
00277   int i;
00278   for(i=1; i < AFFX_STAT_CONTINUED_FRACTION_MAX_ITERATION; i++) {
00279     oldsum = sum;
00280     numerator += log_z;
00281     denominator = log((double)i)+log(a+i);
00282     multiplier *= -1;
00283     sum += log(1 + multiplier * exp(numerator-denominator-sum)); // trying to do it in an overflow-avoiding manner
00284     if (fabs(sum-oldsum) < AFFX_STAT_CONTINUED_FRACTION_EPSILON)
00285       break;
00286   }
00287   
00288   double ans = 1-exp(a*log(z) -  affxstat::log_gamma(a) + sum);
00289   if(doLog)
00290     ans = log(ans);
00291 
00292   return(ans);
00293 }
00294 
00295 double affxstat::Incomplete_Gamma(double a, double z, bool doLog)
00296 {
00297   double ans;
00298 
00299   if (z<=0) {
00300     ans = 1;
00301   } else if(z > 0.03) {
00302     // use continued fraction
00303     return(Incomplete_Gamma_Continued_Fraction(a,z,doLog));
00304   } else {
00305     // use power series
00306     return(Incomplete_Gamma_Power_Series(a,z,doLog));
00307   }
00308 
00309   return(ans);
00310 }
00311 
00312 double Incomplete_Beta_Continued_Fraction(double a, double b, double x)
00313 {
00314         // compute I_x(a,b)
00315         // as [(x^a)*(1-x)^b /(a*Beta(a,b))]*
00316         // 1/(1+c1/1+c2/...) - continued fraction expansion
00317         // c_2n = n(b-n)x/(a+2n-1)*(a+2n)
00318         // c_2n+1 = -(a+n)(a+b+n)x/(a+2n-1)(a+2n)
00319         // take log to fix up...
00320 
00321         double an[3], bn[3];
00322         long j;
00323         long MaxJ = 1000;
00324         double epsilon = AFFX_STAT_CONTINUED_FRACTION_EPSILON;
00325         double old;
00326         double coef;
00327         // start one step into the recurrence
00328         an[1] = 1;
00329         bn[1] = 1;
00330         an[0] = 1-((a+b)*x)/(a+1);
00331         bn[0] = 1;
00332         // use the continued fraction approximation to incomplete beta function
00333         // note - computing 1/(1+(c1)/1+c2/1+...)
00334         // where d (2m+1) = -(a+m)(a+b+m)x/(a+2m)(a+2m+1)
00335         // where d (2m)   = m(b-m)x/(a+2m-1)(a+2m)
00336 
00337         j=1;
00338         while (j<MaxJ)
00339         {
00340                 old = 1/an[0]; // old value
00341                 // 2j j = 1 continues
00342                 // even
00343 
00344                 coef = j*(b-j)*x/((a+2*j-1)*(a+2*j));
00345                 continued_fraction_recurrence(an, bn, coef, 1);
00346                 // 2j+1 j= 0 starts
00347                 // odd
00348 
00349                 coef = -1*(a+j)*(a+b+j)*x/((a+2*j)*(a+2*j+1));
00350                 continued_fraction_recurrence(an, bn, coef , 1);
00351                 j++;  // update j here
00352                 if (fabs(1-an[0]*old)<epsilon)
00353                         break;
00354         }      
00355         // now we've done the continued fraction
00356         // do the coefficient
00357         // exp(a*log(x)+b*log(1-x) +log_gamma(a+b)-log_gamma(a)-log_gamma(b))/a
00358 
00359         return(exp(a*log(x)+b*log(1-x)- affxstat::log_beta(a,b))/(a*an[0]));
00360 }
00361 
00362 double affxstat::Incomplete_Beta(double a, double b, double x)
00363 {
00364         if (x<=0)
00365                 return(0);
00366         if (x>=1)
00367                 return(1); // limiting cases!
00368         // check for convergence criteria
00369         if (x*(a+b+2)<(a+1))
00370                 return(Incomplete_Beta_Continued_Fraction(a,b,x));
00371         else
00372                 return(1-Incomplete_Beta_Continued_Fraction(b,a,1-x));
00373 }
00374 
00375 double affxstat::Ftest(double F, double vone, double vtwo)
00376 {
00377         double a,b,x,s;
00378         x = vtwo/(vtwo+vone*F);
00379         a = vtwo/2;
00380         b = vone/2;
00381         s= affxstat::Incomplete_Beta(a,b,x);
00382         return(s);
00383 }

00386 // Implementation of erf taken directly from MAS5 codebase.
00387 double affxstat::erf(double x) {
00388         static const int erfCoeffSize[] = {4, 8, 5};
00389         static const double erfA1[] = {1.85777706184603153e-1,
00390                 3.16112374387056560,    1.13864154151050156e2,
00391                 3.77485237685302021e2,  3.20937758913846947e3};
00392     static const double erfB1[] = {2.36012909523441209e1,
00393                 2.44024637934444173e2,  1.28261652607737228e3,
00394                 2.84423683343917062e3};
00395         static const double erfA2[] = {2.15311535474403846e-8,
00396                 5.64188496988670089e-1, 8.88314979438837594,
00397                 6.61191906371416295e1,  2.98635138197400131e2,
00398                 8.81952221241769090e2,  1.71204761263407058e3,
00399                 2.05107837782607147e3,  1.23033935479799725e3};
00400     static const double erfB2[] = {1.57449261107098347e1,
00401                 1.17693950891312499e2,  5.37181101862009858e2,
00402                 1.62138957456669019e3,  3.29079923573345963e3,
00403                 4.36261909014324716e3,  3.43936767414372164e3,
00404                 1.23033935480374942e3};
00405         static const double erfA3[] ={1.63153871373020978e-2,
00406                 3.05326634961232344e-1, 3.60344899949804439e-1,
00407                 1.25781726111229246e-1, 1.60837851487422766e-2,
00408                 6.58749161529837803e-4};
00409     static const double erfB3[] = {2.56852019228982242,
00410                 1.87295284992346047,    5.27905102951428412e-1,
00411                 6.05183413124413191e-2, 2.33520497626869185e-3};
00412         static const double erfXBounds[] = {0.46875, 4.0};
00413         static const double invSqrtPi = 0.56418958354775627928; // 1 / sqrt(pi)
00414         
00415         double absX = fabs(x);
00416         double xSquared = absX * absX;
00417         double temp = 0;
00418         
00419 
00420         if (absX <= erfXBounds[0]) {    
00421                 double num = erfA1[0] * xSquared;
00422                 double den = xSquared;
00423                 int last = erfCoeffSize[0];
00424                 for (int i = 1; i < last; i++) {
00425                         num = (num + erfA1[i]) * xSquared;
00426                         den = (den + erfB1[i - 1]) * xSquared;
00427                 }
00428                 return x * (num + erfA1[last]) / (den + erfB1[last - 1]);
00429         }
00430         else {
00431                 if (absX <= erfXBounds[1]) {
00432                         double num = erfA2[0] * absX;
00433                         double den = absX;
00434                         int last = erfCoeffSize[1];
00435                         for (int i = 1; i < last; i++) {
00436                                 num = (num + erfA2[i]) * absX;
00437                                 den = (den + erfB2[i - 1]) * absX;
00438                         }
00439                         temp = (num + erfA2[last]) / (den + erfB2[last - 1]);
00440                 }
00441                 else {
00442                         double xInvSquared = 1.0 / xSquared;
00443                         double num = erfA3[0] * xInvSquared;
00444                         double den = xInvSquared;
00445                         int last = erfCoeffSize[2];
00446                         for (int i = 1; i < last; i++) {
00447                                 num = (num + erfA3[i]) * xInvSquared;
00448                                 den = (den + erfB3[i - 1]) * xInvSquared;
00449                         }
00450                         temp = xInvSquared * (num + erfA3[last]) / (den + erfB3[last - 1]);
00451                         temp = (invSqrtPi - temp) / absX;
00452                 }
00453                 temp = 1 - exp(-xSquared) * temp;
00454                 if (x > 0)      // in fact, we may use if (x > erfXBounds[0])
00455                         return temp;
00456                 else
00457                         return -temp;
00458         }               
00459 }

00462 double affxstat::pnorm(double x, double mu, double sigma, bool lower_tail, bool doLog) {
00463   double prob,e;
00464 
00465   x = (x-mu)/(SQRT_TWO*sigma);
00466   e = ((x > 0) ?  affxstat::erf(x) :  affxstat::erf(-x))/2.0;
00467 
00468   if((lower_tail && x>0) || (!lower_tail && x<0))
00469     prob = 0.5 + e;
00470   else
00471     prob = 0.5 - e;
00472   if(doLog)
00473     prob = log(prob);
00474   return(prob);
00475 }

00477 
00478 //
00479 // Returns nways[n][t] which is defined as the number of ways you can get a rank sum of t from integers (1,...,n).
00480 // Computed using the recursion nways[n][t] = nways[n-1][t] + nways[n-t][t]
00481 //
00482 double ranksum_nways(unsigned int n, unsigned int t) {
00483         static bool first=true;
00484         static double **nways=NULL;
00485 
00486         if(first) {
00487                 first=false;
00488                 nways = new double*[PSIGNRANK_MAX_N];
00489                 for(int i=0; i<PSIGNRANK_MAX_N; i++)
00490                         nways[i] = NULL;
00491         }
00492 
00493         unsigned int ranksum_max = n*(n+1)/2;
00494         unsigned int ranksum_halfmax = (ranksum_max/2);
00495 
00496         if( (n < 0) || (n >= PSIGNRANK_MAX_N) ) {
00497                 throw("Invalid n specified for ranksum_nways\n");
00498                 return(0);
00499         }
00500         if( (t < 0) || (t > ranksum_max) )
00501                 return(0);
00502 
00503         if(nways[n] == NULL) {
00504                 nways[n] = new double[1+ranksum_halfmax];
00505                 for(unsigned int i=0; i <= ranksum_halfmax; i++)
00506                         nways[n][i] = -1;
00507         }
00508         if(t > ranksum_halfmax)
00509                 t = ranksum_max-t;
00510 
00511         if(nways[n][t] < 0) {
00512                 // need to initialize it
00513                 if(n==0)
00514                         nways[n][t] = 1;
00515                 else
00516                         nways[n][t] = ranksum_nways(n-1,t) + ranksum_nways(n-1,t-n);
00517         }
00518 
00519         return(nways[n][t]);
00520 }
00521 
00522 //
00523 // Returns nways[n1][n2][t] which is defined as the number of ways you can get a rank sum
00524 // of t from a sample of size n1 sorted with a sample of size n2.
00525 //
00526 // Computed using the recursion nways[n1][n2][t] = nways[n1-1][n2][t-n1] + nways[n-t][t]
00527 //
00528 double ranksum_nways(int n1, int n2, int t) {
00529         static bool first=true;
00530         static double ***nways=NULL;
00531 
00532         if(first) {
00533                 first=false;
00534                 nways = new double**[PWILCOX_MAX_N];
00535                 for(int i=0; i<PWILCOX_MAX_N; i++) {
00536                         nways[i] = new double*[PWILCOX_MAX_N];
00537                         for(int j=0; j<PWILCOX_MAX_N; j++)
00538                                 nways[i][j] = NULL;
00539                 }
00540         }
00541 
00542         int ranksum_max = n1*n2 + n1*(n1+1)/2;
00543 
00544         if( (n1 < 0) || (n1 >= PSIGNRANK_MAX_N) )
00545                 throw("Invalid n1 specified for ranksum_nways\n");
00546         if( (n2 < 0) || (n2 >= PSIGNRANK_MAX_N) )
00547                 throw("Invalid n2 specified for ranksum_nways\n");
00548         if( (t < 0) || (t > ranksum_max) )
00549                 return(0);
00550 
00551         if(nways[n1][n2] == NULL) {
00552                 nways[n1][n2] = new double[1+ranksum_max];
00553                 for(int i=0; i <= ranksum_max; i++)
00554                         nways[n1][n2][i] = -1;
00555         }
00556 
00557         if(nways[n1][n2][t] < 0) {
00558                 // need to initialize it
00559                 if(n1==0) {
00560                         nways[n1][n2][t] = (t==0);
00561                 } else if(n2==0) {
00562                         int x = n1*(n1+1)/2;
00563                         nways[n1][n2][t] = (t==x);
00564                 } else {
00565                         nways[n1][n2][t] = ranksum_nways(n1,n2-1,t) + ranksum_nways(n1-1,n2,t-n1-n2);
00566                 }
00567         }
00568 
00569         return(nways[n1][n2][t]);
00570 }
00571 
00572 //
00573 // Efficient implementation of wilcoxon rank sum statistic.
00574 //
00575 double affxstat::pwilcox(unsigned int t, unsigned int n1, unsigned int n2, bool lower_tail, bool log_p)
00576 {
00577         if( n1 < 1) {
00578                 throw("n1 must be positive for pwilcox\n");
00579                 //              return(NAN);
00580         }
00581         if( n1 >= PWILCOX_MAX_N) {
00582                 throw("n1 too large for psignrank\n");
00583                 //              return(NAN);
00584         }
00585         if( n2 < 1) {
00586                 throw("n2 must be positive for pwilcox\n");
00587                 //              return(NAN);
00588         }
00589         if( n2 >= PWILCOX_MAX_N) {
00590                 throw("n2 too large for psignrank\n");
00591                 //              return(NAN);
00592         }
00593                 
00594         unsigned int ranksum_max = n1*n2 + (n1*(n1+1))/2;
00595         if(t <= 0) {
00596                 double pval = lower_tail ? 0 : 1;
00597                 if(log_p)
00598                         pval = log(pval);
00599                 return(pval);
00600         }
00601         else if (t >= ranksum_max) {
00602                 double pval = lower_tail ? 1 : 0;
00603                 if(log_p)
00604                         pval = log(pval);
00605                 return(pval);
00606         }
00607 
00608         double divisor = choose(n1+n2,n1);
00609         double pval = 0;
00610         if(t <= (unsigned int) ranksum_max/2) {
00611                 // shorter to compute lower tail, flip if necessary
00612                 for(int i=1; i <= (int)t; i++)
00613                         pval += ranksum_nways((int)n1,(int)n2,i) / divisor;
00614                 if(!lower_tail)
00615                         pval = 1-pval;
00616         } else {
00617                 // shorter to compute upper tail, flip if necessary
00618                 for(unsigned int i=t+1; i <= ranksum_max; i++)
00619                         pval += ranksum_nways((int)n1,(int)n2,i) / divisor;
00620                 if(lower_tail)
00621                         pval = 1-pval;
00622         }
00623 
00624         if(log_p)
00625                 pval = log(pval);
00626                 
00627         return(pval);
00628 }
00629 
00630 
00631 //
00632 // Efficient implementation of wilcoxon signed rank statistic.
00633 //
00634 double affxstat::psignrank(unsigned int t, unsigned int n, bool lower_tail, bool log_p)
00635 {
00636         if( n < 1) {
00637                 throw("n must be positive for psignrank\n");
00638                 //              return(NAN);
00639         }
00640         if( n >= PSIGNRANK_MAX_N) {
00641                 throw("n too large for psignrank\n");
00642                 // return(NAN);
00643         }
00644                 
00645         unsigned int ranksum_max = n*(n+1)/2;
00646         if(t < 0)
00647                 return(0);
00648         else if (t >= ranksum_max)
00649                 return(1);
00650 
00651         double divisor = exp(n*LOG_TWO);    // 2^n
00652         double pval = 0;
00653         if(t <= (unsigned int) ranksum_max/2) {
00654                 // shorter to compute lower tail, flip if necessary
00655                 for(unsigned int i=0; i <= t; i++)
00656                         pval += ranksum_nways(n,i) / divisor;
00657                 if(!lower_tail)
00658                         pval = 1-pval;
00659         } else {
00660                 // shorter to compute upper tail, flip if necessary
00661                 for(unsigned int i=t+1; i <= ranksum_max; i++)
00662                         pval += ranksum_nways(n,i) / divisor;
00663                 if(lower_tail)
00664                         pval = 1-pval;
00665         }
00666 
00667         if(log_p)
00668                 pval = log(pval);
00669                 
00670         return(pval);
00671 }
00672 
00673 
00674 double affxstat::nChooseK(unsigned int n, unsigned int k)
00675 {
00676   if ((n<0) || (k < 0 || k > n))
00677     return 0;
00678   
00679   unsigned int k1 = (k <= n/2)? k : n - k;
00680   double ans = 0;
00681   for (unsigned int i = 0; i < k1; ++i)
00682     ans += log((double)(n-i))-log((double)(i+1));
00683   
00684   return(exp(ans));
00685 }
00686 
00687 
00688 
00689 int rank(double *f, int n, double *r);
00690 void signrank(double *f, int n, double *w, int *m, int *sumTies);
00691 
00692 //
00693 //  This interface is being preserved for legacy reasons.  You are probably better off using one
00694 //  of the other interfaces to signedRankTest.
00695 //
00696 //  Performs a signed rank test, returns logged lower-tail p-value and computes pseudoMedian
00697 //
00698 void affxstat::signedRankTest(double *x, int n, int *tied, int *zero, int *tiedAndZero, double *pval, double *signal) {
00699   bool tied_b,zero_b,tiedAndZero_b;
00700   signedRankTest(x,n,&tied_b,&zero_b,&tiedAndZero_b,pval,ONE_SIDED_LOWER,true);
00701   if(tied_b)
00702     (*tied)++;
00703   if(zero_b)
00704     (*zero)++;
00705   if(tiedAndZero_b)
00706     (*tiedAndZero)++;
00707   *signal = pseudoMedian(x,n);
00708   return;
00709 }
00710 
00711 //
00712 // This interface is for those who don't care to find out how many observations were tied, zero or both.
00713 //
00714 double affxstat::signedRankTest(double *x, int n, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
00715   double pval;
00716   bool tied,zero,tiedAndZero;
00717   signedRankTest(x,n,&tied,&zero,&tiedAndZero,&pval,tail_type,log_p);
00718   return(pval);
00719 }
00720 
00721 //
00722 // Wilcoxon signed rank test (with continuity correction)
00723 //
00724 // Inputs:
00725 //   x: pointer to an array of n doubles
00726 //   n: size of the array of doubles
00727 //   tail_type: one of (ONE_SIDED_UPPER, ONE_SIDED_LOWER, TWO_SIDED)
00728 //   log_p: should the p-value be logged?
00729 // Outputs:
00730 //   tied: will be true if any of the observations are tied
00731 //   zero: will be true if any of the observations are zero
00732 //   tiedAndZero: will be true if at least one observation is zero and at least two observations are tied
00733 //   pval: the p-value, with lower/upper status determined by lower_tail and log/linear status by log_p
00734 //
00735 void affxstat::signedRankTest(double *x, int n, bool *tied, bool *zero, bool *tiedAndZero, double *pval, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
00736   double wilcoxStat;
00737   int nonZero,sumTies;
00738 
00739   signrank(x,n,&wilcoxStat,&nonZero,&sumTies);
00740   *tiedAndZero = *tied = *zero = false;
00741   if(sumTies && (nonZero < n))
00742     *tiedAndZero = true;
00743   else if(sumTies)
00744     *tied = true;
00745   else if(nonZero < n)
00746     *zero = true;
00747 
00748   if(*zero || *tied || *tiedAndZero || n >= APPROX_SIGNRANK_CUTOFF) {
00749     // approximate test
00750     *pval = approxSignrank(wilcoxStat,nonZero,sumTies,tail_type,log_p);
00751   } else {
00752     // exact test
00753     switch(tail_type) {
00754       case ONE_SIDED_LOWER:
00755         *pval = psignrank((unsigned int) wilcoxStat, (unsigned int) nonZero,true,log_p);
00756         break;
00757       case ONE_SIDED_UPPER:
00758         *pval = psignrank((unsigned int) (wilcoxStat-1.0), (unsigned int) nonZero,false,log_p);
00759         break;
00760       case TWO_SIDED:
00761         double median;
00762         median = (nonZero*(nonZero+1)/4.0);
00763         if(wilcoxStat > median)
00764           *pval = psignrank((unsigned int) (wilcoxStat-1.0), (unsigned int) nonZero,false,log_p);
00765         else if(wilcoxStat < median)
00766           *pval = psignrank((unsigned int) wilcoxStat, (unsigned int) nonZero,true,log_p);
00767         else
00768           *pval = (log_p) ? -LOG_TWO : 0.5;
00769         if(log_p)
00770           *pval += LOG_TWO;
00771         else
00772           *pval *= 2.0;
00773         break;
00774       default:
00775         throw("Invalid tail type specified!\n");
00776         break;
00777     }
00778   }
00779 
00780   return;
00781 }
00782 
00783 /*
00784 ** Computes wilcoxon signed rank sum.  The answer is stored in *w and the number of
00785 ** data which went into its calculation is stored in *m.  sumTies will contain the sum
00786 ** of nTies^3 - nTies over all tied groups.
00787 */
00788 void signrank(double *f,int n, double *w, int *m, int *sumTies) {
00789   int i,j,*isPos;
00790   double *absData,*ranks;
00791 
00792   absData = (double *) malloc(n * sizeof(double));
00793   isPos = (int *) malloc(n * sizeof(int));
00794 
00795   /* Get absolute values of non-zero entries. */
00796   for(i=0,j=0; i<n; i++) {
00797     if(fabs(f[i]) > ZERO_COMPARE_EPSILON) {
00798       absData[j] = fabs(f[i]);
00799       isPos[j] = (f[i] > 0);
00800       j++;
00801     }
00802   }
00803   *m = j;
00804 
00805   /* Compute ranks. */
00806   ranks = (double *) malloc(*m * sizeof(double));
00807   *sumTies = ::rank(absData,*m,ranks);
00808 
00809   /* Get rank sum for positive entries. */
00810   for(j=0,*w=0; j<*m; j++) {
00811     if(isPos[j])
00812       *w += ranks[j];
00813   }
00814 
00815   /* Tidy up. */
00816   free(isPos);
00817   free(absData);
00818   free(ranks);
00819 
00820   return;
00821 }
00822 
00823 
00824 //
00825 // Computes the ranks of an array of doubles.  Returns sumTies, which is the sum of nTies^3-nTies for each tied group. */
00826 //
00827 int rank(double *f,int n,double *r) {
00828   double rankSum,thisRank,oldVal;
00829   int i,j,nRanks,last;
00830   int sumTies=0;
00831   Rank *rs;
00832 
00833   /* Initialise the rank structure. */
00834   rs = (Rank *) malloc(n * sizeof(Rank));
00835   for(i=0; i<n; i++) {
00836     rs[i].val = f[i];
00837     rs[i].index = i;
00838   }
00839 
00840   /* Sort the doubles. */
00841   qsort((void *)rs, n, sizeof(Rank), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))(rankCmp));
00842 
00843   /* Assign ranks. */
00844   for(i=0, rankSum=0, last=0, nRanks=0, oldVal=0; i<n; i++) {
00845     if((i == 0) || (fabs(rs[i].val - oldVal) < ZERO_COMPARE_EPSILON)) {
00846       rankSum += i+1;
00847       nRanks++;
00848     } else {
00849       sumTies += (nRanks * nRanks * nRanks) - nRanks;
00850       // printf("nRanks is %d, sumTies is now %d\n",nRanks,sumTies);
00851       thisRank = rankSum/nRanks;
00852       for(j=last; j<i; j++)
00853         rs[j].rank = thisRank;
00854       last = i;
00855       rankSum = i+1;
00856       nRanks = 1;
00857     }
00858     oldVal = rs[i].val;
00859   }
00860   sumTies += (nRanks * nRanks * nRanks) - nRanks;
00861   thisRank = rankSum/nRanks;
00862   while(last < n)
00863     rs[last++].rank = thisRank;
00864 
00865   /* Copy ranks to output array. */
00866   for(i=0; i<n; i++)
00867     r[rs[i].index] = rs[i].rank;
00868 
00869   free(rs);
00870   return(sumTies);
00871 }
00872 
00873 
00874 double approxSignrank(double wilcoxStat, int n, int sumTies, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
00875   double z,sigma;
00876   double logTerm1,logTerm2;
00877 
00878   z = wilcoxStat - n*(n+1)/4.0;
00879   if(n <= 1000) {
00880     sigma = sqrt(n*(n+1)*(2*n+1)/24.0 - sumTies/48.0);
00881   } else {
00882     /* For larger n, we compute sigma the following more complex way to avoid overflow */
00883     if(sumTies > 0) {
00884       logTerm1 = log((double)n)+log((double)(n+1))+log((double)(2*n+1)) - 3.1780538303479457518;
00885       logTerm2 = log((double)sumTies) - 3.8712010109078911491;
00886       sigma = exp(0.5*(logTerm1 + log(1-exp(logTerm2-logTerm1))));
00887     } else {
00888       sigma = exp(0.5*(log((double)n)+log((double)(n+1))+log((double)(2*n+1))-3.1780538303479457518));
00889     }
00890   }
00891   
00892   // apply continuity correction
00893   double correction = 0;
00894   switch(tail_type) {
00895     case ONE_SIDED_LOWER:
00896       correction = 0.5;
00897       break;
00898     case ONE_SIDED_UPPER:
00899       correction = -0.5;
00900       break;
00901     case TWO_SIDED:
00902       correction = (z > 0) ? -0.5 : 0.5;
00903       break;
00904     default:
00905       throw("Invalid tail_type specified!");
00906       break;
00907   }
00908 
00909   double pval;
00910   z = z + correction;
00911   if(tail_type == ONE_SIDED_UPPER) {
00912     pval = pnorm(z,0,sigma,false,log_p);
00913   } else if (tail_type == ONE_SIDED_LOWER) {
00914     pval = pnorm(z,0,sigma,true,log_p);
00915   } else if (tail_type == TWO_SIDED) {
00916     pval = (z > 0) ? pnorm(z,0,sigma,false,log_p) : pnorm(z,0,sigma,true,log_p);
00917     if(log_p)
00918       pval += LOG_TWO;
00919     else
00920       pval *= 2.0;
00921   } else {
00922     throw("Invalid tail_type specified!");
00923   }
00924 
00925   return(pval);
00926 }
00927 
00928 
00929 double affxstat::pseudoMedian(double *x, int n) {
00930   double *walshAvg=NULL;
00931   double pMed;
00932   int nW,i,j,k;
00933 
00934   if(n <= 0) {
00935     fprintf(stderr,"ERROR: pseudoMedian: empty dataset supplied.\n");
00936     return(0);
00937   } else if(n == 1) {
00938     return(x[0]);
00939   } else {
00940     nW = n * (n+1) / 2;
00941     walshAvg = (double *) malloc(nW * sizeof(double));
00942     for(i=0,k=0; i<n; i++)
00943       for(j=i; j<n; j++)
00944         walshAvg[k++] = (x[i] + x[j]) / 2.0;
00945     qsort((void *)walshAvg, nW, sizeof(double), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))(doubleCmp));
00946     if((nW % 2) == 0) {
00947       pMed = 0.5 * (walshAvg[nW/2] + walshAvg[nW/2 - 1]);
00948     } else {
00949       pMed = walshAvg[nW/2];
00950     }
00951     free(walshAvg);
00952     return(pMed);
00953   }
00954 }
00955 
00956 int rankCmp(Rank *a, Rank *b) {
00957   if( a->val > b->val)
00958     return(1);
00959   else if( a->val < b->val)
00960     return(-1);
00961   else
00962     return(0);
00963 }
00964 
00965 int doubleCmp(double *a, double *b) {
00966   if( *a > *b)
00967     return(1);
00968   else if( *a < *b)
00969     return(-1);
00970   else
00971     return(0);
00972 }
00973 
00974 
00975 //
00976 //  This interface is being preserved for legacy reasons.  You are probably better off using one
00977 //  of the other interfaces to ranksumTest.
00978 //
00979 //  Performs a rank sum test, returns logged lower-tail p-value and computes median of all pairwise differences.
00980 //
00981 void affxstat::ranksumTest(double *x1, int n1, double *x2, int n2, int *nTied, double *pval, double *signal, int tail_type) {
00982   bool tied;
00983 
00984   // Do the test
00985   ranksumTest(x1,n1,x2,n2,&tied,pval,tail_type,false);
00986 
00987   // Check if there were ties.
00988   if(tied)
00989     (*nTied)++;
00990 
00991   // compute HL estimator
00992   *signal = medianDifference(x1,n1,x2,n2);
00993 
00994   return;
00995 }
00996 
00997 
00998 
00999 //
01000 // Performs a Wilcoxon signed rank test, returns the computed p-value.
01001 //
01002 double affxstat::ranksumTest(double *x1, int n1, double *x2, int n2, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
01003   double pval=0;
01004   bool tied;
01005   ranksumTest(x1,n1,x2,n2,&tied,&pval,tail_type,log_p);
01006   return(pval);
01007 }
01008 
01009 
01010 
01011 //
01012 // Full interface to Wilcoxon rank sum test.  Returns computed p-value, reports back if there
01013 // were any ties in the data.
01014 //
01015 void affxstat::ranksumTest(double *x, int nX, double *y, int nY, bool *tied, double *pval, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
01016   double rankSumStat;
01017   int sumTies=0;
01018 
01019   rankSum(x,nX,y,nY,&rankSumStat,&sumTies);
01020   *tied = (sumTies != 0) ? true : false;
01021   if(*tied || nX >= APPROX_RANKSUM_CUTOFF || nY >= APPROX_RANKSUM_CUTOFF) {
01022     /* approximate test */
01023     *pval = approxRankSum(rankSumStat,nX,nY,sumTies,tail_type,log_p);
01024   } else {
01025     /* exact test */
01026     switch(tail_type) {
01027       case ONE_SIDED_LOWER:
01028         *pval = pwilcox((unsigned int) rankSumStat, (unsigned int) nX, (unsigned int) nY, true, log_p);
01029         break;
01030       case ONE_SIDED_UPPER:
01031         *pval = pwilcox((unsigned int) (rankSumStat-1), (unsigned int) nX, (unsigned int) nY, false, log_p);
01032         break;
01033       case TWO_SIDED:
01034         double median;
01035         median = ((nX*nY + nX*(nX+1))/2.0);
01036         if(rankSumStat > median)
01037           *pval = pwilcox((unsigned int) (rankSumStat-1), (unsigned int) nX, (unsigned int) nY, false, log_p);
01038         else if(rankSumStat < median)
01039           *pval = pwilcox( (unsigned int) rankSumStat, (unsigned int) nX, (unsigned int) nY, true, log_p);
01040         else
01041           *pval = (log_p) ? -LOG_TWO : 0.5;
01042         if(log_p)
01043           *pval += LOG_TWO;
01044         else
01045           *pval *= 2.0;
01046         break;
01047       default:
01048         throw("Invalid tail type specified!\n");
01049         break;
01050     }
01051   }
01052 
01053   return;
01054 }
01055 
01056 double approxRankSum(double rankSumStat, int n, int m, int sumTies, int tail_type, bool log_p) {
01057   double nm,npm,z,pval,sigma,logTerm1,logTerm2;
01058 
01059   nm = n*m;
01060   npm = n+m;
01061 
01062   z = rankSumStat - (nm + n*(n+1))/2.0;
01063 
01064   /* compute sigma */
01065   if(n <= 1000 && m <= 1000) {
01066     sigma = sqrt(nm * (npm + 1 - sumTies/(npm * (npm-1))) / 12.0);
01067   } else {
01068     if(sumTies > 0) {
01069       logTerm1 = log(nm)+log(npm+1) - 2.4849066497880003546;
01070       logTerm2 = log(nm)+log((double)sumTies) - log(npm) - log(npm+1) - 2.4849066497880003546;
01071       sigma = exp(0.5*(logTerm1 + log(1-exp(logTerm2-logTerm1))));
01072     } else {
01073       sigma = exp(0.5*(log(nm)+log(npm+1) - 2.4849066497880003546));
01074     }
01075   }
01076 
01077 //printf("z is %f, sigma is %f, sumTies is %d\n",z,sigma,sumTies);
01078   /* apply continuity correction */
01079   if(tail_type == ONE_SIDED_UPPER) {
01080     z -= 0.5;
01081   } else if(tail_type == ONE_SIDED_LOWER) {
01082     z += 0.5;
01083     pval = pnorm(z,0,sigma,ONE_SIDED_LOWER,log_p);
01084   } else {
01085     if(z < 0) {
01086       z += 0.5;
01087     } else if (z > 0) {
01088       z -= 0.5;
01089     }
01090   }
01091 //printf("corrected z is %f\n",z);
01092 
01093   if(tail_type == ONE_SIDED_UPPER) {
01094     pval = pnorm(z,0,sigma,false,log_p);
01095   } else if (tail_type == ONE_SIDED_LOWER) {
01096     pval = pnorm(z,0,sigma,true,log_p);
01097   } else if (tail_type == TWO_SIDED) {
01098     pval = (z > 0) ? pnorm(z,0,sigma,false,log_p) : pnorm(z,0,sigma,true,log_p);
01099     if(log_p)
01100       pval += LOG_TWO;
01101     else
01102       pval *= 2.0;
01103   } else {
01104     throw("Invalid tail_type specified!");
01105   }
01106 //printf("pval is %f\n",pval);
01107 
01108   return(pval);
01109 }
01110 
01111 //
01112 // Computes wilcoxon rank sum statistic.  The answer is stored in *w and sumTies
01113 // will contain nTies^3 - nTies summed over all tied groups.
01114 //
01115 void rankSum(double *x, int nX, double *y, int nY, double *w, int *sumTies) {
01116   double *f[2];
01117   double *r[2];
01118   int n[2];
01119   int i;
01120 
01121   f[0] = x;
01122   f[1] = y;
01123   r[0] = (double *) malloc(nX * sizeof(double));
01124   r[1] = (double *) malloc(nY * sizeof(double));
01125   n[0] = nX;
01126   n[1] = nY;
01127   
01128   *sumTies = multi_rank(2,f,n,r);
01129   for(*w=0, i=0; i<nX; i++)
01130     *w += r[0][i];
01131 
01132   free(r[0]);
01133   free(r[1]);
01134 
01135   return;
01136 }
01137 
01138 
01139 //
01140 // Computes the ranks of an array of n lists of doubles, when all are sorted together
01141 //
01142 int multi_rank(int m, double **f, int *n, double **r) {
01143   int N,i,j,l,ties;
01144   Rank *rs;
01145 
01146   /* How many data in total? */
01147   for(N=0,i=0; i<m; i++)
01148     N += n[i];
01149 
01150   /* Initialise the rank structure. */
01151   rs = (Rank *) malloc(N * sizeof(Rank));
01152   for(i=0,l=0; i<m; i++) {
01153     for(j=0; j<n[i]; j++,l++) {
01154       rs[l].val    = f[i][j];
01155       rs[l].index  = j;
01156       rs[l].vector = i;
01157     }
01158   }
01159 
01160   ties = computeRanks(rs,N);
01161 
01162   /* Copy ranks to output array. */
01163   for(i=0; i<N; i++)
01164     r[rs[i].vector][rs[i].index] = rs[i].rank;
01165 
01166   free(rs);
01167   return(ties);
01168 }
01169 
01170 
01171 int computeRanks(Rank *rs, int n) {
01172   double rankSum,thisRank,oldVal;
01173   int i,j,nRanks,last,sumTies;
01174 
01175   /* Sort the doubles. */
01176   qsort((void *)rs, n, sizeof(Rank), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))(rankCmp));
01177 
01178   /* Assign ranks. */
01179   for(i=0, rankSum=0, last=0, nRanks=0, sumTies=0, oldVal=0; i<n; i++) {
01180     if((i == 0) || (fabs(rs[i].val - oldVal) < ZERO_COMPARE_EPSILON)) {
01181       rankSum += i+1;
01182       nRanks++;
01183     } else {
01184       sumTies += (nRanks * nRanks * nRanks) - nRanks;
01185       thisRank = rankSum/nRanks;
01186       /* printf("thisRank is %f, nRanks is %d, sumTies is now %d\n",thisRank,nRanks,sumTies); */
01187       for(j=last; j<i; j++)
01188         rs[j].rank = thisRank;
01189       last = i;
01190       rankSum = i+1;
01191       nRanks = 1;
01192     }
01193     oldVal = rs[i].val;
01194   }
01195   sumTies += (nRanks * nRanks * nRanks) - nRanks;
01196   thisRank = rankSum/nRanks;
01197   while(last < n)
01198     rs[last++].rank = thisRank;
01199 
01200   return(sumTies);
01201 }
01202 
01203 double choose(unsigned int n, unsigned int k) {
01204   unsigned int half_n;
01205 
01206   half_n = n/2;
01207   if(k > half_n)
01208     k = n-k;
01209 
01210   double ans = (double) n / (double) k;
01211   while(--k > 0) {
01212     --n;
01213     ans *= (double) n / (double) k;
01214   }
01215 
01216   return(ans);
01217 
01218 }

01221 //
01222 // Returns the median of all pairwise differences between a two arrays of numbers.
01223 // Used in conjunction with the rank sum test to return the Hodges Lehmann estimator.
01224 //
01225 double affxstat::medianDifference(double *x, int nX, double *y, int nY) {
01226   double *diffs,*diffsP,med;
01227   int nDiffs,i,j;
01228 
01229   if((nX <= 0) || (nY <= 0)) {
01230     throw("medianDifference: neither dataset should be empty.\n");
01231   } else {
01232     nDiffs = nX * nY;
01233     diffs = (double *) malloc(nDiffs * sizeof(double));
01234     diffsP = diffs;
01235     for(diffsP=diffs, i=0; i<nX; i++)
01236       for(j=0; j<nY; j++)
01237         *diffsP++ = x[i] - y[j];
01238     qsort((void *)diffs, nDiffs, sizeof(double), (int (*)(const void*, const void*))(doubleCmp));
01239     if((nDiffs % 2) == 0) {
01240       med = 0.5 * (diffs[nDiffs/2] + diffs[nDiffs/2 - 1]);
01241     } else {
01242       med = diffs[nDiffs/2];
01243     }
01244     free(diffs);
01245     return(med);
01246   }
01247 }
01248 
01249 double affxstat::PearsonCorrelation(float *x1, float *x2, int nPoints, float(*transform)(float x))
01250 {
01251  if (nPoints < 2){
01252   return(numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN());
01253  }
01254  // Compute the means of the data
01255  double mean1=0;
01256  double mean2=0;
01257  for(int i=0; i<nPoints; i++)
01258  {
01259          mean1 = mean1 + (transform == NULL ? x1[i] : transform(x1[i]));
01260          mean2 = mean2 + (transform == NULL ? x2[i] : transform(x2[i]));
01261  }
01262  mean1 = mean1/nPoints;
01263  mean2 = mean2/nPoints;
01264  
01265  // compute the cross product sums and the sum of squares
01266  double crossproduct=0;
01267  double ssq1=0;
01268  double ssq2=0;
01269  for(int i=0; i<nPoints; i++)
01270  {
01271   crossproduct = crossproduct+((transform == NULL ? x1[i] : transform(x1[i]))-mean1)*((transform == NULL ? x2[i] : transform(x2[i]))-mean2);
01272   ssq1 = ssq1 + ((transform == NULL ? x1[i] : transform(x1[i]))-mean1)*((transform == NULL ? x1[i] : transform(x1[i]))-mean1);
01273   ssq2 = ssq2 + ((transform == NULL ? x2[i] : transform(x2[i]))-mean2)*((transform == NULL ? x2[i] : transform(x2[i]))-mean2);
01274  }
01275  if ((ssq1 ==0) || (ssq2==0)){
01276   return(numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN());
01277  }
01278 
01279  double correlation = crossproduct/(sqrt(ssq1)*sqrt(ssq2));
01280  return( correlation );
01281 }

01284 
01285 /* The following functions are taken from the GTYPE code base to calculate the Hardy-Weinburg equilibrium value. */
01286 
01287 const double PI = 3.1415926535897932384626433832795;
01288 const double TINY = 1e-20;
01289 const double Eps = numeric_limits<double>::epsilon();
01290 const double RelativeBound = 5 * Eps;
01291 const int MaxIterations = 5000;
01292 const int MeaningLess = -9999;
01293 
01294 //----------------------------------//
01295 static double logGamma( double x)
01296 //----------------------------------//
01297 {
01298         static double a[8] = {5.7083835261e-03, -1.910444077728e-03,
01299                 8.4171387781295e-04, -5.952379913043012e-04,
01300                 7.93650793500350248e-04, -2.777777777777681622553e-03,
01301                 8.333333333333333331554247e-02, 0.9189385332046727417803297};
01302 
01303         static double c1[9] = {4.945235359296727046734888e0,
01304                 2.018112620856775083915565e2, 2.290838373831346393026739e3,
01305                 1.131967205903380828685045e4, 2.855724635671635335736389e4,
01306                 3.848496228443793359990269e4, 2.637748787624195437963534e4,
01307                 7.225813979700288197698961e3, -5.772156649015328605195174e-1};
01308         
01309         static double d1[8] = {6.748212550303777196073036e1,
01310                 1.113332393857199323513008e3, 7.738757056935398733233834e3,
01311                 2.763987074403340708898585e4, 5.499310206226157329794414e4,
01312                 6.161122180066002127833352e4, 3.635127591501940507276287e4,
01313                 8.785536302431013170870835e3};
01314      
01315         static double c2[9] = {4.974607845568932035012064e0,
01316                 5.424138599891070494101986e2, 1.550693864978364947665077e4,
01317                 1.847932904445632425417223e5, 1.088204769468828767498470e6,
01318                 3.338152967987029735917223e6, 5.106661678927352456275255e6,
01319                 3.074109054850539556250927e6, 4.227843350984671393993777e-1};
01320 
01321         static double d2[8] = {1.830328399370592604055942e2,
01322                 7.765049321445005871323047e3, 1.331903827966074194402448e5,
01323                 1.136705821321969608938755e6, 5.267964117437946917577538e6,
01324                 1.346701454311101692290052e7, 1.782736530353274213975932e7,
01325                 9.533095591844353613395747e6};
01326                 
01327         static double c4[9] = {-1.474502166059939948905062e4,
01328                 -2.426813369486704502836312e6, -1.214755574045093227939592e8,
01329                 -2.663432449630976949898078e9, -2.940378956634553899906876e10,
01330                 -1.702665737765398868392998e11, -4.926125793377430887588120e11,
01331                 -5.606251856223951465078242e11, 1.791759469228055000094023e0};
01332 
01333         static double d4[8] = {-2.690530175870899333379843e3,
01334                 -6.393885654300092398984238e5, -4.135599930241388052042842e7,
01335                 -1.120872109616147941376570e9, -1.488613728678813811542398e10,
01336                 -1.016803586272438228077304e11, -3.417476345507377132798597e11,
01337                 -4.463158187419713286462081e11};
01338 
01339         double numerator = 0;
01340         double denominator = 1;
01341         int n = 8;
01342 
01343         if (x <= Eps) {
01344                 return - log(x);
01345         }
01346         else if (x <= 0.5) {
01347                 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
01348                         numerator = x * numerator + c1[i];
01349                         denominator = x * denominator + d1[i];
01350                 }
01351                 return - log(x) + x * (x * numerator / denominator + c1[n]);
01352         }
01353         else if (x <= 0.6796875) {
01354                 double z = x - 1;
01355                 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
01356                         numerator = z * numerator + c2[i];
01357                         denominator = z * denominator + d2[i];
01358                 }
01359                 return -log(x) + z * (z * numerator / denominator + c2[n]);
01360         }
01361         else if (x <= 1.5) {
01362                 double z = x - 1;
01363                 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
01364                         numerator = z * numerator + c1[i];
01365                         denominator = z * denominator + d1[i];
01366                 }
01367                 return z * (z * numerator / denominator + c1[n]);
01368         }
01369         else if (x <= 4) {
01370                 double z = x - 2;
01371                 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
01372                         numerator = z * numerator + c2[i];
01373                         denominator = z * denominator + d2[i];
01374                 }
01375                 return z * (z * numerator / denominator + c2[n]);
01376         }
01377         else if (x <= 12) {
01378                 double z = x - 4;
01379                 for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
01380                         numerator = z * numerator + c4[i];
01381                         denominator = z * denominator + d4[i];
01382                 }
01383                 return z * numerator / denominator + c4[n];
01384         }
01385         else {
01386                 double z = x * x;
01387                 numerator = a[0];
01388                 for (int i = 1; i <= 6; ++i) {
01389                         numerator = numerator / z + a[i];
01390                 }
01391                 numerator /= x;
01392                 return numerator + log(x) * (x - 0.5) - x + a[7];
01393         }       
01394 }
01395 
01396 //----------------------------------------------------//
01397 static double incompleteGamma( double x,  double a) 
01398 //----------------------------------------------------//
01399 {
01400         if (x == 0) {
01401                 return 0;
01402         }
01403         
01404         bool convergence = false;
01405         double logGammaA = (a < TINY) ? logGamma(a+Eps) : logGamma(a);
01406 
01407         if (x < a + 1) {
01408                 double temp = 1.0 / a;
01409                 double update = temp;
01410                 double a0 = a;  
01411                 for (int i = 0; i < MaxIterations; ++i) {
01412                         if (fabs(update) < RelativeBound * fabs(temp)) {
01413                                 convergence = true;
01414                                 break;
01415                         }
01416                         a0 = a0 + 1;
01417                         update = x * update / a0;
01418                         temp += update;
01419                 }
01420                 if (!convergence) 
01421                 {
01422                         return -1;
01423                 }
01424                 return temp * exp(a * log(x)  - x - logGammaA);
01425         }
01426         else {
01427                 double p0 = 1,  p1 = x, q0 = 0, q1 = 1;
01428                 double c = 1, fold = q0, fnew = q1;
01429                 for (int i = 1; i < MaxIterations; ++ i) {
01430                         if (fabs(fnew - fold) < RelativeBound * fabs(fnew)) {
01431                                 convergence = true;
01432                                 break;
01433                         }
01434                         fold = fnew;
01435                         double iMinusA = i - a;
01436                         p0 = (p0 * iMinusA + p1) * c;
01437                         q0 = (q0 * iMinusA + q1) * c;
01438                         double iTimesC = i * c;
01439                         p1 = p1 * iTimesC + p0 * x;
01440                         q1 = q1 * iTimesC + q0 * x;
01441                         c = 1.0 / p1;
01442                         fnew = q1 * c;
01443                 }
01444                 if (!convergence) {
01445                         return -1;
01446                 }
01447                 return 1 - fnew * exp(a * log(x) - x - logGammaA);
01448         }
01449 }
01450 
01451 //----------------------------------------------//
01452 static double chiSquareCDF( double x,  int df) 
01453 //----------------------------------------------//
01454 {
01455         if (x <= 0.0) 
01456         {
01457                 return 0.0;
01458         }
01459         else 
01460         {
01461                 double y = incompleteGamma(x / 2.0, df / 2.0);
01462                 if (y > 1.0)
01463                         y = 1.0;
01464                 if (y < 0.0)
01465                         y = 0.0;
01466                 return y;
01467         }
01468 }
01469 
01470 double affxstat::CalcHWEqPValue(int nAA, int nAB, int nBB)
01471 {
01472     if (nAA + nAB + nBB <= 0)
01473         return 1.0;
01474 
01475         double fPHW = 0.0f;
01476         double fa = 0.0f, fb = 0.0f, fab = 0.0f, fchi = 0.0f, faa = 0.0f, fbb = 0.0f;
01477         double fea = 0.0f, feb = 0.0f, feab = 0.0f;
01478         double fTotal = nAA + nAB + nBB;
01479 
01480         fa = nAA/fTotal;
01481         fb = nBB/fTotal;
01482         fab = nAB/fTotal;
01483 
01484         faa = fa + 0.5*fab;
01485         fbb = fb + 0.5*fab;
01486 
01487         if(faa <= 0.0 || fbb <= 0.0)
01488                 return 1.0;
01489 
01490         fea = fTotal*faa*faa;
01491         feab = 2*fTotal*faa*fbb;
01492         feb = fTotal*fbb*fbb;
01493 
01494         fchi = (fea - nAA)*(fea - nAA)/fea + 
01495                         (feab - nAB)*(feab - nAB)/feab + 
01496                         (feb - nBB)*(feb - nBB)/feb;
01497 
01498         fPHW = 1- chiSquareCDF(fchi, 1);
01499         fPHW = max(fPHW, 0.0);
01500         fPHW = min(fPHW, 1.0);
01501 
01502         return fPHW;
01503 }
